009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Binary region segmentation based on a recursive (depth-first) flood filling
018 * algorithm. See Sec. 8.1.1 (Alg. 8.2) of [1] for additional details.
019 * Note that this implementation may easily run out of stack space and
020 * should be used for demonstration purposes only.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
024 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2020/04/01
029 * @version 2022/09/28 revised
030 */
031public class RecursiveSegmentation extends BinaryRegionSegmentation {
032
033        /**
034         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image,
035         * which is not modified. The input image is considered binary, with 0 values
036         * for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground pixels.
037         * The 4-neighborhood is used by default ({@link BinaryRegionSegmentation#DefaultNeighborhoodT}).
038         * 
039         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
040         */
041        public RecursiveSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
042                this(ip, DefaultNeighborhoodT);
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image and
047         * neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood). The input image is considered
048         * binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground
049         * pixels.
050         * 
051         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
052         * @param nh the neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood)
053         */
054        public RecursiveSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
055                super(ip, nh);
056        }
057        
058        @Override
059        boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
060                try{
061                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
062                                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
063                                        if (getLabel(u, v) == Foreground) {     // = unlabeled foreground
064                                                // start a new region
065                                                int label = getNextLabel();
066                                                floodFill(u, v, label);
067                                        }
068                                }
069                        }
070                } catch(StackOverflowError e) {
071                        return false;
072                }
073                return true;
074        }
075
076        private void floodFill(int x, int y, int label) {
077                if ((x >= 0) && (x < width) && (y >= 0) && (y < height) && getLabel(x, y) == Foreground) {
078                        setLabel(x, y, label);
079                        floodFill(x + 1, y, label);
080                        floodFill(x, y + 1, label);
081                        floodFill(x, y - 1, label);
082                        floodFill(x - 1, y, label);
083                        if (NT == NeighborhoodType2D.N8) {
084                                floodFill(x + 1, y + 1, label);
085                                floodFill(x - 1, y + 1, label);
086                                floodFill(x + 1, y - 1, label);
087                                floodFill(x - 1, y - 1, label);
088                        }
089                }
090        }
091
092}
